TopicTitle: Made Kerbin Teeny-tiny-cutesy-wootesy. Seriously it's small.

Articles.Content:
Javascript is disabled. View full album

I made Kerbin 1/100 of the stock scale for fun and profit. No I'm not releasing it. Yes it's buggy as hell. Listen to this while viewing:

Heck, just go play this game when you're done with KSP for the day: http://outerwilds.com/about/

Anyway, I've been trying to get this to work nicely, but when I later tried flattening the ground in the config and launched a ship, I just got a Hell Kraken.

Edited February 22, 2015 by GregroxMun
Did you try multiple launches, and have them all get the Kraken, also what's gilly like ?

Holy tiny planet, Batman!

Some of those pictures are starting to look micro rather than macroscopic... looks sweet!

A few months ago, I quipped:

I wonder how small one could make it (Kerbin) with the game still being playable? (not including balance, of course it's going to be imbalanced as hail)

1%?

0.1%?

What's the "you can make a rocket that's the size of the planet if you try hard enough" limit?

This begs further research!

..And someone makes it. This community.

Have my rep, good sir.

A few months ago, I quipped:

..And someone makes it. This community.

Have my rep, good sir.

It was Gregroxx who made that other config too, wonder how long til 0.1% scale...

Did you try multiple launches, and have them all get the Kraken, also what's gilly like ?

I only did Kerbin, Mun, and Minmus, but doing the math, Gilly would be small enough to hug. (About 16 m across)

And Hell kraken happens eventually every time. Next time I tried it, I launched fine, but hell kraken'd during climb to orbit. I never hell krakened when I played with EVA Kerbanauts though.

- - - Updated - - -

It was Gregroxx who made that other config too, wonder how long til 0.1% scale...

No I didn't make 1/10 stock system, Metaphor did that. I suspect that 0.1% scale would never work. At all. But I shall attempt it because it seems horrible.

Oh, look, the desert temple!

Very cool.

I can't remember where or when, but there was a mod that came out months ago that not only did this, but also made the game playable! They even managed to flatten out the ground a bit.

[EDIT: Sorry, found it. They made Kerbin 10x larger than you did, which would account for the fact that nothing was this hideously glitched.]

Still really, really cool though.

BTW Gregrox, you seem to be a lot more active on the Forums lately (e.g.: yesterday, you started five threads). Have you been free from school/college/work lately?

-Upsilon

Edited February 22, 2015 by UpsilonAerospace

I can't remember where or when, but there was a mod that came out months ago that not only did this, but also made the game playable! They even managed to flatten out the ground a bit.

You're thinking of the 1/10 Kerbol system mod.

This is 10x smaller than that. 1/100 Kerbol system, if you will.

You're thinking of the 1/10 Kerbol system mod.

This is 10x smaller than that. 1/100 Kerbol system, if you will.

I realize that now, and I actually edited my post a minute before your reply.

How do you adjust these settings, anyway? Do you need to get RSS and then edit the configuration files, as Metaphor did? Or is there some other way?

-Upsilon

BTW Gregrox, you seem to be a lot more active on the Forums lately (e.g.: yesterday, you started five threads). Have you been free from school/college/work lately?

-Upsilon

Yes actually. Snow and Ice caused a lot of cancelled school and only one day of college classes.

And here's what happens when you use 0.1% scale. Doesn't really work by any means. Like, you can't even launch.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Approaching true Outer Wilds or Science of The Spheres scale, but the easter-egg mountains seem to cause a problem. Also we can't launch.

PQS genuinely HATES being forced into such small scales anyway, though I recall that Metaphor did manage to actually create in PlanetFactory (When PF was still in its infancy) a tiny little planet that you could rover around in a few seconds. Very much approaching the true B612 of that xkcd what-if article (book nerds will yell at me for not also mentioning Le Petit Prince as the origin of that).

- - - Updated - - -

I realize that now, and I actually edited my post a minute before your reply.

How do you adjust these settings, anyway? Do you need to get RSS and then edit the configuration files, as Metaphor did? Or is there some other way?

-Upsilon

I edited the RSS config.

EDIT: I found Metaphor's old teeny-tiny planets.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Unfortunately he never released it. Maybe it's time I jumped back into planet creation using the new KopernicusTech stuff.

Wow, there's a lot of cool stuff in Metaphor's imgur page.

Edited February 22, 2015 by GregroxMun
Oh my god you did it. 0.1% scale. Hmm... This has me wondering, what if you just made Gilly 0.1% scale and tried to cover it in structural panels. GregroxMun, you need to do it now. FOR SCIENCE!

When Metaphor announed his 1/10th Kerbin, I became excited (and impatient) and made my own version - to facilitate the development of such, I'd actually made a rescaling engine, and had been working on a 1% Kerbin system, although the bugs were getting out of control at that point, and I abandoned it.

You can also see an accidental 1/100th (1%) Kerbin in my original release shots (second shot; was not intended, that was from the initial work prior to the script and I was mixing up "1% RSS" and "10% Kerbin"):

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Any RSS person should know what to do with it (the left justified line is simply a header with planet's name, it's GM, and parent, basically debug output)

Oh my god you did it. 0.1% scale. Hmm... This has me wondering, what if you just made Gilly 0.1% scale and tried to cover it in structural panels. GregroxMun, you need to do it now. FOR SCIENCE!

PQS would abandon me as a human being, jump out of space, beat me up into little pieces, make me into structural panels that are extremely thin, and then cover me around Phobos.

- - - Updated - - -

I tried using KopernicusTech to make a tiny little Minmus MintChip Sprinkle around Kerbin, but I could find no examples of using KopernicusTech to change PQS settings, to it instantly went from 125m radius to a spiky blob that is as much radius as the highest of Minmus' mountains from ground level. It was cute when i was approaching it in my ship though. I still really want someone to properly make a Sprinkle.

Here's what I had:

@Kopernicus 
{
	Body
    {
        name = Sprinkle
        flightGlobalsIndex = 538
        Template
        {
            name = Minmus
        }
        Properties
        {
			description = An unbelievably tiny little package of Minmus-Mintchip icecream found orbiting Kerbin, but with an insanely dense core! Scientists suspect it is a thrown-off chunk of Minmus' own core, and fascinating insights into the structure of Minmus itself might be gained from experimentation on the object.
			radius = 125
			geeASL = 1
			tidallyLocked = False
			rotationPeriod = 124.3
			initialRotation = 180
			timewarpAltitudeLimits = 0 2 2 3 3 4 4 10
			ScienceValues
			{
				landedDataValue = 17
				splashedDataValue = 17
				flyingLowDataValue = 16
				flyingHighDataValue = 16
				inSpaceLowDataValue = 15
				inSpaceHighDataValue = 15
				recoveryValue = 12
				flyingAltitudeThreshold = 25000
				spaceAltitudeThreshold = 50000
			}
        }
        Orbit
        {
			referenceBody = Kerbin
			inclination = 17.15
			eccentricity = 0.25
			semiMajorAxis = 1800000
			longitudeOfAscendingNode = 62
			argumentOfPeriapsis = 115
			meanAnomalyAtEpoch = 5.8
			epoch = 0
		}
		ScaledVersion
        {

        }
	}



}

Here's what it looked like on approach, before entering the SOI.

When you get too close to a scaledspace object, because in fact the scaledspace object is 1/6000 scale (or is it 1/600 scale?), the object clips into your camera and disappears.

- - - Updated - - -

When Metaphor announed his 1/10th Kerbin, I became excited (and impatient) and made my own version - to facilitate the development of such, I'd actually made a rescaling engine, and had been working on a 1% Kerbin system, although the bugs were getting out of control at that point, and I abandoned it.

You can also see an accidental 1/100th (1%) Kerbin in my original release shots (second shot; was not intended, that was from the initial work prior to the script and I was mixing up "1% RSS" and "10% Kerbin"):

http://imgur.com/a/nkn0d

Here's what my 1% Kerbin looked like just prior to the end of the project:

http://alpha.renegrade.net/images/Stock-1PercentKerbinExp.jpg

Well yeah, I can plug those in, but then PQS would go mad with huge spikey mountains everywhere. Can you just release your project?

- - - Updated - - -

You know what guys? Fine I'll go to Gilly. At least using the 1/10 stock system config I can make Gilly flat. Probably. Hopefully. Almost certainly not.

Edited February 22, 2015 by GregroxMun

Well yeah, I can plug those in, but then PQS would go mad with huge spikey mountains everywhere. Can you just release your project?

Um, I could post the full config files, they're 0.24 based though and I can't recall if I touched the PQS beyond Kerbin's SOI or not. (it looks like I did touch 'em, but it is prolly untested, and possibly values from my 10% as the 1% started as simply a copy paste)

If you (or anybody) want to play it, I've just now posted it here:

http://alpha.renegrade.net/Kerbin1Percent.zip

The good news is that it has a 1%-compatible powercurve

(my 10 percent one is in the same place, just with "10" instead of "1". Again with the 0.24 caveat.)

Edited February 22, 2015 by Renegrade
Am I the only one who is reminded of Spore planets by those tiny KSP planets?

Am I the only one who is reminded of Spore planets by those tiny KSP planets?

Spore is about 1/100 Earth size (1/10 Stock Kerbal size), so yeah.

- - - Updated - - -

Looks like Gilly becomes completely dark when you're inside the SOI. From the sun, anyway. I'm going to try to give my ship lights to illuminate it.

EDIT: Ship light barely work at all. And I still crashed. The game really does get glitchy when you try and do these ridiculous scales!

Javascript is disabled. View full album

0.1% scaled Gilly. About 130 meters across.

Edited February 22, 2015 by GregroxMun

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Tested your 1% config, Renegrade.

I never hell krakened when I played with EVA Kerbanauts though.

And I assume that Kerbonauts in EVA have enough delta V for interplanetary transfers?

http://imgur.com/a/Ijanv

Tested your 1% config, Renegrade.

Yeah, I don't accurately recall how far along it got. I know I got the orbits and masses plunked in from the script, as well as the power curve, but PQS was being a PITA. Even at 10%, Minmus just seemed to flat out ignore any changes I threw at it, and the Mun's procedural craters went 'meh' at any directives I put in :/

I'd really love to get some epically tiny planets done, but all that fighting with KSP/RSS wore me down.
Reminds me of the Besiege main menu.

PQS would abandon me as a human being, jump out of space, beat me up into little pieces, make me into structural panels that are extremely thin, and then cover me around Phobos.

What? I don't care, do it! If that doesn't work, try 1%! (I think it will be 2.3 km in diameter, just within the 2.5 km deload range)
That reminds me of the Yes: Fragile album cover artwork, done by Roger Dean.

Are you using a mod that affects how Kerbin looks, alongside shrinking the planet? The water and terrain of Kerbin (while erratic) looks very nice in these pictures.

Mini Kerbin is cute.
When Metaphor started in with the 10% business, I was immediately reminded of this: xkcd What If #68. I still want to experience that~
